Name: Bis(chloromethyl) ether
Description: Bis(chloromethyl) ether is an ether that is dimethyl ether in which one of the hydrogens attached to each of the methyl group has replaced by a chlorine. It has a role as a carcinogenic agent and an alkylating agent. It is an ether and an organochlorine compound.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Fishbein L; Sci Total Environ 11: 223-57 (1979) (2) Tou JC et al; J Phys Chem 78: 1096-98 (1974)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: Bis(chloromethyl) ether hydrolyzes rapdily in water(1,2) and, therefore, is not expected to bioconcentrate in aquatic organisms(SRC).

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Grant, W.M. Toxicology of the Eye. 3rd ed. Springfield, IL: Charles C. Thomas Publisher, 1986., p. 327
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Exposure of rabbits for 3 min to atmosphere saturated with /bis(chloromethyl) ether vapor/ caused milky corneal opacity and CNS depression.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Grant, W.M. Toxicology of the Eye. 3rd ed. Springfield, IL: Charles C. Thomas Publisher, 1986., p. 327
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ A 0.05 mL drop /of bis(chloromethyl) ether/ on a rabbit's eye caused conjunctival erosion and corneal opacity.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V4 235 (1974)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ Nominal concentation ... 0.005 mg/L (5 mg/cu m) /1 ppm/ bis(chloromethyl) ether ... introduced into chamber containing 50 strain A/He mice ... 6 hr/day for 5 days/wk, for a total of 82 exposure days in 27 wk. 6 Of the surviving 47 ... exhibited lung tumors, with an average of 2.9 tumors/mouse. In untreated controls held under the same conditions 20/49 had lung tumors /with an average of 0.9 tumors/mouse/. ... Positive control group exposed to 0.05 mg/L urethane for 130 days, 46/49 animals had lung tumors ( ... 54 tumors/mouse).

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V4 235 (1974)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ ... Sprague-Dawley rats ... in inhalation chambers for 6 hr/day on 5 days/wk ... (0.1 ppM or 0.5 mg/cu m) for a total of 101 exposures. After 659 days all 30 animals at risk were dead. Of 19 animals in which pathological exam was completed at the time of reporting 5 died between 332 and 463 days after the beginning of the test with squamous cell carcinomas of the lung. /Controls for this experiment not discussed in this review. /

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V4 235 (1974)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ Newborn ... male and female ICR Swiss random bred mice ... given single sc injection of ... max tolerated dose of 12.5 uL BCME/kg ... in peanut oil soln. ... Killed and examined ... after 6 months. ... Pulmonary tumors developed in 45% ... In addition, 1 ... injection site papilloma and ... /1/ fibrosarcoma; such tumors were not seen in control animals. ... In vehicle controls ... 7/50 mice had lung tumors. Positive control animals were given single sc dose of 1500 mg/kg urethane. 100% /positive control mice/ had lung tumors.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Leong B KJ et al; Toxicol Appl Pharmacol 58 (2): 269 (1981)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ Rats were exposed to 100, 10 and 1 ppb of bis(chloromethyl)ether vapors 6 hr/day, 5 days/wk for 6 mo and observed for lifespan. No abnormalities observed in hematology, exfoliative cytology of lung washes, or cytogenetic parameters of bone marrow cells observed at end of 6 mo. (Interim sacrifice). However of rats exposed to 100 ppb, 86.5% developed esthesioneuroepitheliomas and 4% lung adenomas /by terminal sacrifice but no remarkable effects at 10 ppb/.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V4 234 (1974)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ ... 2 mg bis(chloromethyl) ether dissolved in 0.1 mL benzene were applied to skin of female ICR/Ha Swiss mice 3 times/wk for ... 325 days. Papillomas developed in 13/20 mice, 12 ... progressed to squamous cell carcinomas by 325 days. First papilloma ... seen at 161 days, first carcinoma at 231 days. /Controls for this experiment not discussed in this review. /

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V4 236 (1974)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ ... 20 female Sprague-Dawley rats received once weekly sc injections of 3 mg ... in 0.1 mL Nujol ... after 100 days, dose ... 1 mg/wk because of local irritation ... later ... injections ... reduced to 3 times/mo, and ... discontinued ... after 300 days. After median survival time of 325 days, 2 local fibromas and 5 fibrosarcomas ... seen. Control animals without treatment or injected repeatedly with 0.1 mL Nujol exhibited no local tumors.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ ... Incidence of pulmonary squamous cell carcinomas and esthesioneuroepitheliomas of the nose in a small series of rats exposed to inhalation of BCME in a concentration of 0.1 ppm.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ Both BCME and /Chloromethyl methyl ether/ CMME are powerful alkylating agents... that are mutagenic in bacteria.

V100 (2012)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ BCME did not cause chromosomal aberrations in bone-marrow cells of rats exposed to vapors for six months.

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Staples CA et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 4: 131-4 (1985)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: USEPA STORET DATABASE, 213 sediment data points, 0% pos for bis(chloromethyl) ether(1).

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Fishbein L; Sci Total Environ 11: 223-57 (1979) (2) Tou JC et al; J Phys Chem 78: 1096-98 (1974)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Bis(chloromethyl) ether hydrolyzes rapidly in water(1-2) and, therefore, adsorption to soil and leaching are not expected to be important fate processes(SRC).
